questions.promptMd: Which phrase MOST supports interest‑based collaboration?

answers.contentMd: ‘How can we structure this to reduce your risk within budget?’
‘We won’t move unless you concede first’

questions.promptMd: Which sequence BEST facilitates option generation?

answers.contentMd: List interests → brainstorm options without judging → evaluate against criteria
Start with criteria only → then decide
answers.feedbackMd: Criteria are useful but need option space.

answers.contentMd: Vote on positions → create options if tie

questions.promptMd: True or False: Reframing from ‘positions’ to ‘problems’ reduces defensiveness and expands solution space.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Problem framing invites curiosity and joint work.
